parameters.name: AccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with the budget whose notification you want to update.

parameters.name: BudgetName
parameters.description: The name of the budget whose notification you want to update.

parameters.name: OldNotification
parameters.description: The previous notification that is associated with a budget. Specifies whether the notification is for how much you have spent ( ACTUAL) or for how much that you're forecasted to spend ( FORECASTED). The comparison that's used for this notification. The threshold that's associated with a notification. Thresholds are always a percentage, and many customers find value being alerted between 50% - 200% of the budgeted amount. The maximum limit for your threshold is 1,000,000% above the budgeted amount. ThresholdType (string) --- The type of threshold for a notification. For ABSOLUTE_VALUE thresholds, Amazon Web Services notifies you when you go over or are forecasted to go over your total cost threshold. For PERCENTAGE thresholds, Amazon Web Services notifies you when you go over or are forecasted to go over a certain percentage of your forecasted spend. For example, if you have a budget for 200 dollars and you have a PERCENTAGE threshold of 80%, Amazon Web Services notifies you when you go over 160 dollars. NotificationState (string) --- Specifies whether this notification is in alarm. If a budget notification is in the ALARM state, you passed the set threshold for the budget.

nested_params.name: NotificationType
nested_params.description: Specifies whether the notification is for how much you have spent ( ACTUAL) or for how much that you're forecasted to spend ( FORECASTED).

nested_params.name: Threshold
nested_params.description: The threshold that's associated with a notification. Thresholds are always a percentage, and many customers find value being alerted between 50% - 200% of the budgeted amount. The maximum limit for your threshold is 1,000,000% above the budgeted amount.

For ABSOLUTE_VALUE thresholds, Amazon Web Services notifies you when you go over or are forecasted to go over your total cost threshold. For PERCENTAGE thresholds, Amazon Web Services notifies you when you go over or are forecasted to go over a certain percentage of your forecasted spend. For example, if you have a budget for 200 dollars and you have a PERCENTAGE threshold of 80%, Amazon Web Services notifies you when you go over 160 dollars.

nested_params.name: NotificationState
nested_params.description: Specifies whether this notification is in alarm. If a budget notification is in the ALARM state, you passed the set threshold for the budget.

parameters.name: NewNotification
parameters.description: The updated notification to be associated with a budget. Specifies whether the notification is for how much you have spent ( ACTUAL) or for how much that you're forecasted to spend ( FORECASTED). The comparison that's used for this notification. The threshold that's associated with a notification. Thresholds are always a percentage, and many customers find value being alerted between 50% - 200% of the budgeted amount. The maximum limit for your threshold is 1,000,000% above the budgeted amount. ThresholdType (string) --- The type of threshold for a notification. For ABSOLUTE_VALUE thresholds, Amazon Web Services notifies you when you go over or are forecasted to go over your total cost threshold. For PERCENTAGE thresholds, Amazon Web Services notifies you when you go over or are forecasted to go over a certain percentage of your forecasted spend. For example, if you have a budget for 200 dollars and you have a PERCENTAGE threshold of 80%, Amazon Web Services notifies you when you go over 160 dollars. NotificationState (string) --- Specifies whether this notification is in alarm. If a budget notification is in the ALARM state, you passed the set threshold for the budget.
